item.title: Hydraulic oil pollution on road and footpath, 22nd February
item.description:
The pollution is a result of contractors faulty equipment leaking hydraulic oil during repairs to the road on Monday 16th February, the oil has now soaked in to the dirt and adjacent gully.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 6, Grosvenor Road, Upper Belvedere, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Two lime bikes parked to cause maximum hazard to pedestrians, 22nd February
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 12, Sandringham Road, Shacklewell, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: E8 Lime bike dumped dangerously on footway used by blind pedestrians, 22nd February
item.description:

item.title: Stopcock access cover missing, 22nd February
item.description:
The cover for the water stopcock outside 31-36 Hargrave Mansions is missing. This has left a hole approximately 100x100 mm in the pavement. This could cause someone to roll their ankle or trip over.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 31-36 Hargrave Mansions, Hargrave Road, Archway, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Newlands Park street name plate missing from remaining pair of short poles, jct of Newlands Park and Lennard Rd, Penge, 22nd February
item.description:
Newlands Park street name plate missing from remaining pair of short poles, jct of Newlands Park and Lennard Rd, Penge (opposite the Penge East Station parade of shops). Perhaps the SNP is in the hedging - I could not see it There is Police blue / white hazard tape around and locals report a vehicle collision in the last week. Police should have driver details to reclaim the cost of reinstatement. As an additional comment, may I suggest installation of robust, kerbside bollards on this 90° main road corner. There is a demolished residential low wall from at least two previous collisions. I fear it is only a matter of time before a vehicle crashes into the inhabited maisonettes on the corner here No.s 1-4 Newlands Croft, Lennard Rd. Please also refer my request to the Highways Dept.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lennard Road, Penge, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
